title: Square Textile, 19th century
medium:
Medium: cotton
Technique: wax resist dyeing (batik) on plain weave
description: Cotton square, possibly a head cloth (kain kepala), in dark blue, light brown, and white. Dark blue ground showing numerous white dots known as "gabah sinawur" or 'grains of rice'. The "semen" (curling tendrils and other non-geometric forms) and "sawat" (wings and tail of Garuda, mount of Vishnu) motifs are also used.

tombstone.epitaph:
Square Textile, 19th century.Medium: cotton
Technique: wax resist dyeing (batik) on plain weave. Gift of Alan L. Wolfe. 1962-233-7.
